content: Zhaoyu Cheng is a graduate student at UIUC, he is applying for a second MS degree in Computer Science. He is equipped with essential CS knowledge by taking Data Structures, Database Systems and Machine Learning at UIUC and he is looking for a Software Engineer intern. His research interests include algorithms, computer networks and machine learning.
summary: Zhaoyu Cheng is a graduate student at UIUC, he is applying for a second MS degree in Computer Science. He is equipped with essential CS knowledge by taking Data Structures, Database Systems and Machine Learning at UIUC and he is looking for a Software Engineer intern.
title: Zhaoyu Cheng

content:
This blog system is driven by React Hooks, Next.js, Egg.js, MySQL and Antd Design. You can check the code in my github repo.
 Build front-end Build the middleware and connect with frontend Build backstage management system  Front End Main Page This is the main page for this Blog, it basically consists of top and recent articles, the self introduction, the header and some place for advertisement. Article You can easily check the addtime, type and view count of this article and get access to full text. The main page is built with code highlighter List You can check the list of articles in certain types here. In the picture below, the “Article” list of articles are shown. Detailed Page The detailed page supports Markdown and syntax highlighting with the help of highlight.js and marked. Framework I used egg.js, which was invented by Alibaba Group on the basis of the KOA.js.
BackStage Login page List AddArticle Real-time Preview The adding article function supports real-time preview for what you are writing
summary: Fullstack personal blog built with React Hooks, MySQL, KOA and antd design
title: Fullstack Blog System

content: Utilized LiDAR and camera to help robot navigate autonomously under crop canopy Designed failure self-recovery strategies using Markov Decision Process to reduce labor costs Studied how to use Gazebo to simulate the robot
title: Terrasentia Robot

content:
This is the fianl project for CS411 at UIUC. We processed a 10GB database and you can check our website here and our source code here
 Built a web application using React, Apollo and GraphQL that can visualize the trends of popular topics and corresponding publications, visualize the most cited authors and articles, find the connections between different authors and search with keywords Utilized Neo4j database to store connections between articles and authors and generalize the list of related articles Visualized the popularity of research topics with a graph to show the number of publications for a selected year and how the number changed in the past decade Displayed the most cited articles on one of the top three trending topics or research interests
summary: Fullstack project built with React, GraphQl and Apollo
title: GoogleScholarDatasetVisualization
